info.title: Ticket API
info.description: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: dateissued
parameters.description: The date the ticket was issued.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: issuedby
parameters.description: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

parameters.name: pricecurrency
parameters.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

parameters.name: reservedticket
parameters.description: A ticket associated with the reservation.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: ticketedseat
parameters.description: The seat associated with the ticket.

parameters.name: ticketnumber
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the ticket.

parameters.name: tickettoken
parameters.description: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

parameters.name: totalprice
parameters.description: The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

parameters.name: undername
parameters.description: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

description.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
The date the ticket was issued.
A short description of the item.
An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
The organization issuing the ticket or permit.
Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.
Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
The seat associated with the ticket.
The unique identifier for the ticket.
Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.
The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.
